results.title: Drugs and the nervous system
results.brief_description: An animated film explaining how drugs acting on the nervous system affect the body, emphasising the danger of indiscriminate use of common drugs taking aspirin as an example. Discusses the harmful effects of narcotics, stimulants and depressants and hallucinogens. Suitable for children aged from 13 years onwards.

results.title: Drug abuse: one town's answer
results.creator_credit: Pat Shields and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description: The story of the Awareness House concept, as begun in Fort Bragg, California, which provides a meaningful alternative to drugs. “Turn on to people, not drugs”. Ex-addicts, who are experienced drug specialists, provide counselling and realistic drug abuse information. The teenagers involved talk freely about their reasons for giving up narcotics.

results.title: Drown-proofing
results.creator_credit: Norman Keziere, Joe Hayward and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Outdoor Education and Recreation”.
Designed to help teach swimmers and non-swimmers alike how to survive a water accident, by showing how to stay afloat and travel in water, even if you have never learned to swim. The majority of men and women can remain on the surface in fresh water, and in salt water the human body is even more buoyant.

results.title: Drought in Botswana
results.creator_credit: Harold Eastwood, Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations and United Nations
results.brief_description: Illustrates the World Food Program famine relief in Botswana which began in 1965 after five years of drought had decimated the country. Relief was provided for over 100,000 Kalahari bushmen. Covers tribal traditions and all aspects of the assistance program.

results.title: Drought (D)
results.creator_credit: Tristram Miall, Robert Loader and Golden Dolphin
results.brief_description: Powerful introduction to drought and other dramatic aspects of Australia’s climate, including bushfires, floods, cyclones. Examines how native plants and animals have adapted to these conditions, and looks at the history of European occupation. WARNING: Contains disturbing scenes of the agonising death of a herd of wild horses at a dry water hole and recommend viewing suitable for upper secondary student level only.

results.title: Driving: risks and responsibilities
results.brief_description: Cars have become an essential tool in most businesses and the risks and responsibilities associated with driving on the job are the primary focus of this program. Outlines the costs incurred to businesses when a car accident occurs, the benefits of a safe driving program and safe driving policy, as well as basic practices to ensure the safety of the driver, other road users, pedestrians and the car itself. Useful as a basic guide to vehicle safety for the instruction of new and learner drivers.

results.title: Driving without tears
results.creator_credit: Hector Lemieux, Peter Jones and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: We accompany a driving instructor to see how the City of Vancouver trains expert and responsible motorists. Shows how a driving school gives both theoretical and practical teaching on all the intricacies of city and highway traffic. The film includes reference to training programs in secondary schools to make teenagers better drivers.
